decision_conditions: The proposal would result in loss of permanent residential accommodation, which is contrary to established adopted planning policies seeking the retention of such accommodation in the light of chronic shortage housing in the Borough. There is also a significant concern with respect to the location of the premises, which is not separated from other houses, thereby having potentially adverse impact upon the amenities of the adjoining family housing and other local residents by reason of comings and goings and other noise and disturbances issues associated with the use building of the building as a hostel. Furthermore, the building is not located within an accessible area and it also is away from shopping facilities rendering the location of the building for the propose use unsuitable The proposal is therefore contrary to policies CP1 (Housing Supply) CP2 (Sustainable Communities), DC1 (loss of housing), DC4 (conversion to residential and subdivision of residential uses), DC5 (specialist

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mr. Khan via email on 13.11.2019
description: The proposal is a retrospective application for change of use of the existing dwelling from C3 to Sui Generie use as a hostel providing no significant element of care.
